meanings.definition: The act of sending money as payment.
meanings.sent1: She made her monthly remitments to pay for the rent.
meanings.sent2: He always ensures his remitments are sent on time to avoid late fees.
meanings.sent3: The remitments for the bills felt like little gifts sent out each month.
meanings.sent4: Her remitments were like tiny messengers carrying her financial responsibilities away.
meanings.sent5: The concept of remitments made her feel like a responsible adult managing her finances.

meanings.definition: A task or duty that is assigned or required to be completed.
meanings.sent1: His daily remitments included feeding the pets and taking out the trash.
meanings.sent2: Completing all his remitments at work gave him a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent3: The remitments of doing chores felt like a never-ending cycle.
meanings.sent4: Her remitments at school were like puzzle pieces fitting into her daily routine.
meanings.sent5: The remitments of studying for exams were challenging but rewarding in the end.

meanings.definition: The act of forgiving or pardoning a debt or offense.
meanings.sent1: His remitments towards her past mistakes showed his forgiving nature.
meanings.sent2: The remitments of old grudges brought peace to their relationship.
meanings.sent3: Forgiving others and offering remitments can lead to a happier life.
meanings.sent4: Her remitments towards those who wronged her were like releasing heavy burdens.
meanings.sent5: The power of remitments can mend broken relationships and heal old wounds.
